00015 
00016 #include <stdio.h>
00017 #include <stdlib.h>
00018 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00019 #include "Lgm/Lgm_WGS84.h"
00020 
00021 
00022 /*
00023  *  Attempt to trace to Earth in both directions.
00024  *  If the field line is closed, then also trace to equatorial plane.
00025  *  
00026  *      v1 is northern footprint (at 120 km)
00027  *      v2 is southern footprint (at 120 km)
00028  *      v3 is equatorial crossing point  (Minimum B)
00029  *  
00030  *  
00031  *  Return values. Function returns:
00032  *  
00033  *  
00034  *      LGM_OPEN_IMF     (==0) if field line is open at both ends (i.e. an IMF FL)
00035  *      LGM_CLOSED       (==1) if field line is closed (v1, v2, v3 all valid)
00036  *      LGM_OPEN_N_LOBE  (==2) if field line is northern lobe FL (v1 valid)
00037  *      LGM_OPEN_S_LOBE  (==3) if field line is southern lobe FL (v2 valid)
00038  *
00039  *      LGM_INSIDE_EARTH (==3) initial point is inside Earth (no points valid)
00040  *
00041  *
00042  *  Changed June 13, 2008
00043  *      Added TOL1 and TOL2 args. They wer hard set at 0.01 and 1e-7
00044  *  Changed October 14, 2008
00045  *      Added Height argument.  (Height is height in km above Earth to stop at)
00046  *  Original version quite old (early 90's?)
00047  *  
00048  */
00049 int Lgm_Trace( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v1, Lgm_Vector *v2, Lgm_Vector *v3, double Height, double TOL1, double TOL2, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00050 
00051     int         i, reset, flag1, flag2, InitiallyBelowTargetHeight, done;
00052     double      sgn=1.0, R, Rtarget, Rinitial, Rplus;
00053     Lgm_Vector  w, Bvec;
00054     double      h, h2_inv, F[7], s, Hdid, Hnext, Htry;
00055     double      GeodLat, GeodLong, GeodHeight;
00056     Lgm_Vector  u_scale, P;
00057 
00058 
00059 
00060     /*
00061      * Determine our initial geocentric radius in km. (u is assumed to be in
00062      * units of Re where we define Re to be WGS84_A.)
00063      */
00064     Rinitial = WGS84_A*Lgm_Magnitude( u ); // km
00065 
00066 
00067     /*
00068      * The Earth is a spheroid. It is more flattened at the poles than at the
00069      * equator.  Check to see if we are initially at a height where we need to
00070      * worry about it. For WGS84 Earth shape model, the equatorial radius is
00071      * WGS84_A and polar radius is WGS84_B (WGS84_B is about 20km smaller than
00072      * WGS84_A).
00073      */
00074     if ( Rinitial < WGS84_B ) {
00075 
00076         // must be inside the Earth, which is no good -- bail with
00077         // LGM_INSIDE_EARTH error code
00078         return( LGM_INSIDE_EARTH );
00079 
00080     } else if ( Rinitial < WGS84_A ) {
00081 
00082         // we are between WGS84_A and WGS84_B ( i.e. WGS84_B < Rinitial <
00083         // WGS84_A).  we could still be in trouble in terms of being inside the
00084         // Earth, so we have to check more thouroughly now. Determine Geodetic
00085         // Lat, Lon and Height
00086         Lgm_WGS84_to_GEOD( u, &GeodLat, &GeodLong, &GeodHeight );
00087 
00088         if ( GeodHeight < 0.0 )  {
00089 
00090             // inside the Earth, which is no good -- bail with error
00091             return( LGM_INSIDE_EARTH );
00092 
00093         }
00094 
00095     }
00096 
00097 
00098     // determine the desired target height in km
00099     Rtarget  = WGS84_A + Height;
00100 
00101 
00102     /*
00103      * Note, that if the initial point is already below the target height it
00104      * must be attached to the Earth at least at that point.  So keep track of
00105      * status of initial point. Also in this case, we will have trouble trying
00106      * to trace in one of the directions.  A solution in this case is to try to
00107      * trace in the proper direction to get use above the target height -- then
00108      * attempt the trace in both directions.
00109      */
00110 
00111     // determine if we are initially below the target height
00112     InitiallyBelowTargetHeight = ( Rinitial <= Rtarget ) ? TRUE : FALSE; 
00113 
00114     // determine which direction will take us above the target R
00115     if (InitiallyBelowTargetHeight){
00116         Htry = 0.01; // step finely
00117         reset = TRUE;
00118         P = *u;
00119         Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, 1.0, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00120         Rplus = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00121         if (Rplus > Rinitial ) {
00122             sgn =  1.0;
00123         } else {
00124             sgn = -1.0;
00125         }
00126 
00127         done = FALSE;
00128         Htry = 0.01; // step finely
00129         reset = TRUE;
00130         P = *u;
00131         while( !done ) {
00132             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00133             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00134             if (R > Rtarget) {
00135                 done = TRUE;
00136             } else if ( R < Rinitial ) {
00137                 done = TRUE;
00138                 return( -1 );
00139             }
00140             
00141         }
00142 
00143     }
00144     
00145 
00146 
00147 
00148 
00149 
00150 
00151 
00152     /*
00153      * Try to get to the Earth by tracing along the field in either direction.
00154      */
00155     sgn = -1.0;
00156     Info->Hmax = 10.0;
00157 Info->Hmax = 0.50;
00158 Info->Hmax = 0.10;
00159     flag2 = Lgm_TraceToEarth(  u, v2, Height, -sgn, TOL1, Info );
00160     flag1 = Lgm_TraceToEarth(  u, v1, Height,  sgn, TOL1, Info );
00161 
00162     
00163 
00164     Info->smin = -9e99;
00165     Info->Bmin = -9e99;
00166 
00167 
00168     if ( flag1 && flag2 ) {
00169 
00170         /*
00171          *  Closed FL -- attempt to trace to Eq Plane.
00172          */
00173         Lgm_TraceToMinBSurf( v1, v3, TOL1, TOL2, Info );
00174         Info->Pmin = *v3;
00175         Info->smin = Info->Trace_s;     // save location of Bmin. NOTE:  Smin is measured from the southern footpoint.
00176         Info->Bfield( v3, &Bvec, Info );
00177         Info->Bvecmin = Bvec;
00178         Info->Bmin = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00179 
00180     } else if ( flag1 ) {
00181 
00182         Lgm_Convert_Coords( v1, &w, GSM_TO_SM, Info->c );
00183         return( (w.z > 0.0) ? LGM_OPEN_N_LOBE : LGM_OPEN_S_LOBE );
00184 
00185 
00186     } else if ( flag2 ) {
00187 
00188         Lgm_Convert_Coords( v2, &w, GSM_TO_SM, Info->c );
00189         return( (w.z > 0.0) ? LGM_OPEN_N_LOBE : LGM_OPEN_S_LOBE );
00190 
00191     } else if ( InitiallyBelowTargetHeight ) {
00192 
00193         Lgm_Convert_Coords( u, &w, GSM_TO_SM, Info->c );
00194         return( (w.z > 0.0) ? LGM_OPEN_N_LOBE : LGM_OPEN_S_LOBE );
00195 
00196     } else {
00197 
00198         /*
00199          *  IMF
00200          */
00201         return( LGM_OPEN_IMF );
00202 
00203     }
00204 
00205 
00206 
00207 
00208     /*
00209      *  Finally, if we need to, lets determine the curvature of |B| at Bmin.
00210      * 
00211      *  Why would you need this? Well, the short answer is that we dont always
00212      *  need it. But if we ever want to compute the Sb integral for nearly
00213      *  equatorially mirroring particles and we do it with an interpolated
00214      *  array of B(s), the resulting integrals can be very inaccurate. On the
00215      *  other hand, for nearly equatorially mirroring particles, Sb can be
00216      *  obtained simply as an expansion that involves both Bmin and d^2B/ds^2.
00217      * 
00218      *  Thus, compute d^2B/ds^2 if we need it later.
00219      *  Use a 7-point formula;
00220      *
00221      *        2    (2)      1  (                                                          )
00222      *      h    F      =  --- (  2F   - 27F  +  270F  - 490F + 270F    - 27F    +  2F    )
00223      *             0       180 (    3       2        1       0      -1       -2        -3 )
00224      *      
00225      *                            F[0]    F[1]     F[2]    F[3]   F[4]      F[5]    F[6]   
00226      */
00227 
00228 
00229     h      = 0.01;     // Re
00230     h2_inv = 10000.0;  // Re^(-2)
00231     F[3] = Info->Bmin;
00232     u_scale.x =  100.0;  u_scale.y = 100.0; u_scale.z = 100.0; reset = TRUE;
00233     for (i=-3; i<=3; i++){
00234         if (i != 0) {
00235             s = i*h;
00236             P = Info->Pmin;
00237             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, s, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, -1.0, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00238             Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00239             F[i+3] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00240             //printf("F[%d] = %g Hdid = %g\n", i, F[i+3], Hdid);
00241         }
00242     }
00243     Info->d2B_ds2 = h2_inv/180.0 * ( 2.0*F[0] - 27.0*F[1] + 270.0*F[2] - 490.0*F[3] + 270.0*F[4] - 27.0*F[5] + 2.0*F[6] );
00244     //printf("d2B_ds2 = %g\n", d2B_ds2);
00245 
00246     Info->Sb0 = M_PI*M_SQRT2*sqrt( Info->Bmin/Info->d2B_ds2 );
00247     //printf("Sb0 = %g\n", Info->Sb0);
00248     
00249 
00250 
00251 
00252     return( LGM_CLOSED );
00253 
00254 
00255 
00256 }
00257 
00258 
00259 /*
00260  *   $id$
00261  */
